with the argument for that conclusion, but it will show that somethingis
wrong with the argument, because it cannot be sound if its conclusion is
false. That might be enough in some situations.
For example, suppose someone argues that because there is a tallest moun-
tain  and  a  heaviest  human,  there  must  also  be  a  largest  integer.  We  might
respond by arguing as follows: Suppose there is a largest integer. Call it N.
Since Nis an integer, N+ 1 is also
